text:
Compiled Apache httpd-2.0.43 under Solaris 8 x86 using gcc-3.2.  The following
configuration script was used:

env CC=gcc \
    CFLAGS="-O9 -march=pentium3 -mcpu=pentium3 -L/usr/local/lib -R/usr/local/lib" \
./configure --build=i686-sun-solaris2.8 \
            --host=i686-sun-solaris2.8 \
            --prefix=/opt/apache-2.0 \
            --with-mpm=worker \
            --enable-mods-shared=all \
            --enable-cgi \
            --enable-ssl \
            --with-ssl=/usr/local/ssl \
            --with-z=/usr/local/lib

Using Netscape 7 under Windows NT 4.0 SP6a, I enter the URL
"http://server-name/server-status/" I get a "document contains no data" error
and the following messages in the Apache error log:

[Fri Oct 04 12:48:49 2002] [notice] Apache/2.0.43 (Unix) DAV/2 PHP/4.2.3
configured -- resuming normal operations
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:04 2002] [notice] child pid 10422 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:04 2002] [notice] child pid 10421 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:06 2002] [notice] child pid 10425 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:07 2002] [notice] child pid 10427 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:07 2002] [notice] child pid 10426 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:09 2002] [notice] child pid 10428 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:10 2002] [notice] child pid 10430 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:10 2002] [notice] child pid 10429 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)
[Fri Oct 04 12:49:12 2002] [notice] child pid 10431 exit signal Illegal
instruction (4)

Apache httpd-2.0.40 built with exactly the same compiler and using the same
configuration works properly.

Thank you.

Bernard Michaud
Systems Administrator
Industry Canada
creator: michaud.bernard@ic.gc.ca
trawick@apache.org
text:
Can you provide a back trace from a coredump?  There are notes
on how to do this at

http://httpd.apache.org/dev/debugging.html

creator: info@orangexl.com
text:
Are you sure it has noting to do with PHP? I had a similiar problem when 
requesting any file on my FreeBSD box after I installed PHP.
No response from submitter.  Assuming issue is resolved.
creator: slive@apache.org
